definition: insect or insect-like small creature (literary)/base person (used as a curse word)
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic
worm-like invertebrate/mythical animal (see 獬豸[xie4 zhi4])/radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 153)

sentences.english: These insects can simulate dead leaves .
sentences.chinese: 這些蟲豸可以假裝成枯葉。

sentences.english: Ancient Chinese call their neighboring people as "bugs" or"barbarians".
sentences.chinese: 古代漢族人把他們的鄰居稱作“蟲豸”或“蠻子”。

sentences.english: Myriads of small marine insects swarm the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 無數的海中小蟲豸聚集在陸地中。

definition: (bird species of China) grey heron (Ardea cinerea)
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to lie in disarray/to cut across/to traverse
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
